column5: Sleded and I got the boat out for one last shot at the pike yesterday on long point bay. After being tossed around and soaked out in the lake with nothing to show for our efforts besides a ton of floating vegetation, we moved into some sheltered canals to target the panfish which were plentiful in them. We had a good day and went home with 12 decent perch, the rest were released. The trip back home was brutal though even though the lake had flattened a bit.
You boys worked for that catch...

Don't blame you for deciding that is it for the year. A cold nasty and not so productive day like that can help make that decision. I know it's a tough choice to make and a sad one indeed, but the boat has to be put to rest eventually. Until next season that is!
Good on you for getting out there in those conditions!  Great report Rich....the boat may be put away, but I know we'll be seeing some more reports!
way to tough it out for your last boat trip
